intro: Pelexia mattogrossensis, commonly known as the Brazilian pelexia, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible rhubarb-like stems. The plant features upright, branched stems covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a waxy coating. Pelexia mattogrossensis produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming during the wet season.
